intro: Consolida regalis var. mollis, commonly known as the velvet flower or sweet rocket, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its delicate, velvety petals that range in color from pale pink to deep red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a nectar source for pollinators.
